orestes.bloomfilter

Class FilterBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • orestes.bloomfilter.FilterBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class FilterBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    Builder for Bloom Filters.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructs a new Bloom Filter Builder using the specified size in bits and the specified number of hash functions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilterBuilder

        public FilterBuilder()
        Constructs a new builder for Bloom filters and counting Bloom filters.

      • FilterBuilder

        public FilterBuilder(int expectedElements,
             double falsePositiveProbability)
        Constructs a new Bloom Filter Builder by specifying the expected size of the filter and the tolerable false positive probability. The size of the BLoom filter in in bits and the optimal number of hash functions will be inferred from this.
        Parameters:
        expectedElements - expected elements in the filter
        falsePositiveProbability - tolerable false positive probability

      • FilterBuilder

        public FilterBuilder(int size,
             int hashes)
        Constructs a new Bloom Filter Builder using the specified size in bits and the specified number of hash functions.
        Parameters:
        size - bit size of the Bloom filter
        hashes - number of hash functions to use

    • Method Detail

      • expectedElements

        public FilterBuilder expectedElements(int expectedElements)
        Sets the number of expected elements. In combination with the tolerable false positive probability, this is used to infer the optimal size and optimal number of hash functions of the filter.
        Parameters:
        expectedElements - number of expected elements.
        Returns:
        the modified FilterBuilder (fluent interface)

        the modified FilterBuilder (fluent interface)

      • falsePositiveProbability

        public FilterBuilder falsePositiveProbability(double falsePositiveProbability)
        Sets the tolerable false positive probability. In combination with the number of expected elements, this is used to infer the optimal size and optimal number of hash functions of the filter.
        Parameters:
        falsePositiveProbability - the tolerable false
        Returns:
        the modified FilterBuilder (fluent interface)

      • hashes

        public FilterBuilder hashes(int numberOfHashes)
        Set the number of hash functions to be used.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the modified FilterBuilder (fluent interface)

      • countingBits

        public FilterBuilder countingBits(int countingBits)
        Sets the number of bits used for counting in case of a counting Bloom filter. For non-counting Bloom filters this setting has no effect.

        Default: 16

        Parameters:
        countingBits -
        Returns:
        the modified FilterBuilder (fluent interface)

      • name

        public FilterBuilder name(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the Bloom filter. If a redis-backed Bloom filter with the provided name exists and it is compatible to this FilterBuilder configuration, it will be loaded and used. This behaviour can be changed by overwriteIfExists(boolean).

        Default: ""

        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        the modified FilterBuilder (fluent interface)

      • redisBacked

        public FilterBuilder redisBacked(boolean redisBacked)
        Instructs the FilterBuilder to build a Redis-Backed Bloom filters.

        Default: false

        Parameters:
        redisBacked - a boolean indicating whether redis should be used
        Returns:
        the modified FilterBuilder (fluent interface)

        Returns:

      • overwriteIfExists

        public FilterBuilder overwriteIfExists(boolean overwrite)
        Sets whether any existing Bloom filter with same name should be overwritten in Redis.

        Default: false

        Parameters:
        overwrite - boolean indicating whether to overwrite any existing filter with the same name
        Returns:
        the modified FilterBuilder (fluent interface)

      • addReadSlave

        public FilterBuilder addReadSlave(java.lang.String host,
                         int port)
        Adds a read slave to speed up reading access (e.g. contains or getEstimatedCount) to normal and counting Redis-backed Bloom filters. The read slave has to be a slave of the main Redis instance (this can be done in the redis-cli using the SLAVEOF command). This setting might cause stale reads since Redis replication is asynchronous. However anecdotally, in our experiments, we were unable to read any stale data - the replication lag between both Redis instances was small than one round-trip time to Redis.
        Parameters:
        host - host of the Redis read slave
        port - port of the Redis read slave
        Returns:
        the modified FilterBuilder (fluent interface)

      • hashFunction

        public FilterBuilder hashFunction(HashProvider.HashMethod hashMethod)
        Sets the method used to generate hash values. Possible hash methods are documented in the corresponding enum HashProvider.HashMethod.

        Default: MD5

        For the generation of hash values the String representation of objects is used.

        Parameters:
        hashMethod - the method used to generate hash values
        Returns:
        the modified FilterBuilder (fluent interface)

      • hashFunction

        public FilterBuilder hashFunction(HashProvider.HashFunction hf)
        Uses a given custom hash function.
        Parameters:
        hf - the custom hash function
        Returns:
        the modified FilterBuilder (fluent interface)

      • buildBloomFilter

        public <T> BloomFilter<T> buildBloomFilter()
        Constructs a Bloom filter using the specified parameters and computing missing parameters if possible (e.g. the optimal Bloom filter bit size).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of element contained in the Bloom filter.
        Returns:
        the constructed Bloom filter

      • buildCountingBloomFilter

        public <T> CountingBloomFilter<T> buildCountingBloomFilter()
        Constructs a Counting Bloom filter using the specified parameters and by computing missing parameters if possible (e.g. the optimal Bloom filter bit size).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of element contained in the Counting Bloom filter.
        Returns:
        the constructed Counting Bloom filter

      • complete

        public FilterBuilder complete()
        Checks if all necessary parameters were set and tries to infer optimal parameters (e.g. size and hashes from given expectedElements and falsePositiveProbability). This is done automatically.

      • isCompatibleTo

        public boolean isCompatibleTo(FilterBuilder other)
        Checks wether a configuration is compatible to another configuration based on the size of the Bloom filter and its hash functions.
        Parameters:
        other - the other configuration
        Returns:
        true if the configurations are compatible

      • optimalM

        public static int optimalM(long n,
           double p)
        Calculates the optimal size size of the bloom filter in bits given expectedElements (expected number of elements in bloom filter) and falsePositiveProbability (tolerable false positive rate).
        Parameters:
        n - Expected number of elements inserted in the bloom filter
        p - Tolerable false positive rate
        Returns:
        the optimal size size of the bloom filter in bits

      • optimalK

        public static int optimalK(long n,
           long m)
        Calculates the optimal hashes (number of hash function) given expectedElements (expected number of elements in bloom filter) and size (size of bloom filter in bits).
        Parameters:
        n - Expected number of elements inserted in the bloom filter
        m - The size of the bloom filter in bits.
        Returns:
        the optimal amount of hash functions hashes

      • optimalN

        public static int optimalN(long k,
           long m)
        Calculates the amount of elements a Bloom filter for which the given configuration of size and hashes is optimal.
        Parameters:
        k - number of hashes
        m - The size of the bloom filter in bits.
        Returns:
        amount of elements a Bloom filter for which the given configuration of size and hashes is optimal.

              long m,
              double insertedElements)
        Calculates the best-case (uniform hash function) false positive probability.
        Parameters:
        k - number of hashes
        m - The size of the bloom filter in bits.
        insertedElements - number of elements inserted in the filter
        Returns:
